metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: Loops can execute a block of code as long as a specified condition is reached.
content.html: Loops can execute a block of code as long as a specified condition is reached.

content.text: Loops are handy because they save time, reduce errors, and they make code more readable.
content.html: Loops are handy because they save time, reduce errors, and they make code more readable.

content.text: The while loop loops through a block of code as long as a specified condition is true :
content.html: The while loop loops through a block of code as long as a specified condition is true:

content.code_html:
while (condition) {
  // code block to be executed
}

content.text: In the example below, the code in the loop will run, over and over again, as long as a variable (i) is less than 5:
content.html: In the example below, the code in the loop will run, over and over again, as long as a variable (i) is less than 5:

content.code:
int
i
=

0
;


while

(
i
<

5
)

{


System
.
out
.
println
(
i
)
;

i
++
;


}
content.code_html:
int i = 0;
while (i < 5) {
  System.out.println(i);
  i++;
}

content.text: Note: Do not forget to increase the variable used in the condition, otherwise the loop will never end!
content.html: Note: Do not forget to increase the variable used in the condition, otherwise the loop will never end!

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
How many times will the following loop execute? int i = 0; while (i < 4) { i++; }
content.html:
How many times will the following loop execute?
int i = 0;
while (i < 4) {
  i++;
}
